metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12401 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
During ECDSA signature generation, padding applied in the nonce designed to ensure constant-time scalar multiplication was removed, resulting in variable-time execution dependent on secret data. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 80 and Firefox for Android < 80.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12401` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss3 - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm7
libnss3-1d - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm7
libnss3-nssdb - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm7
libnss3-tools - 2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
nss package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:3.28.4-0ubuntu0.14.04.5+esm7').
